item.title: Chris add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "The burning of a book is a sad, sad sight, for even though a book is nothing but ink and paper, it feels as if the ideas contained in the book are disappearing as the pages turn to ashes and the cover and binding--which is the term for the stitching and glue that holds the pages together--blacken and curl as the flames do their wicked work. When someone is burning a book, they are showing utter contempt for all of the thinking that produced its ideas, all of the labor that went into its words and sentences, and all of the trouble that befell the author . . ." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Chris add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Chris add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "The weak are cruel. The strong have no need to be." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Chris add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "...and Heaven have mercy on us all - Presbyterians and Pagans alike - for we are all somehow dreadfully cracked about the head, and sadly need mending." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Chris add a quote by Chris Lynch
item.description: "I thought about mistakes I had made in the past. I thought about when things went wrong. And I realized it was never an issue of <i>intent,</i> but of <i>intensity.</i> I was a good guy, recall." -- Chris Lynch

item.title: Chris add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "There are just some kind of men…who’re so busy worrying about the next world they’ve never learned to live in this one." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Chris add a quote by Harper Lee
Chris add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "His rage passes description - the sort of rage that is only seen when rich folk that have more than they can enjoy suddenly lose something that they have long had but have never before used or wanted." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Chris add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "It does not do to leave a live dragon out of your calculations, if you live near him." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Chris add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "There is more in you of good than you know, child of the kindly West. Some courage and some wisdom, blended in measure. If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Chris add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Then something Tookish woke up inside him, and he wished to go and see the great mountains, and hear the pine-trees and the waterfalls, and explore the caves, and wear a sword instead of a walking-stick." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Chris add a quote by M.T. Anderson
item.description: "Lily told her about what had happened so far. (If you're interested, you can go back to the beginning of the book and read all the way through to this point again.)" -- M.T. Anderson

item.title: Chris add a quote by M.T. Anderson
item.description: "You know who you should ask about this? My pal Ray, who works with me. He could tell you all about this." Lily's dad nodded. "Except he was taken out of the office a few days ago with his hands tied behind his back and a bandanna tied as a gag on his mouth." Her father thought for a second. "Huh. He hasn't been in to work since. I wonder if he has the flu." -- M.T. Anderson

item.title: Chris add a quote by Frances Hardinge
item.description: "Everybody knew that books were dangerous. Read the wrong book, it was said, and the words crawled around your brain on black legs and drove you mad, wicked mad." -- Frances Hardinge

item.title: Chris add a quote by Frances Hardinge
item.description:
"Where is your sense of patriotism?"
I keep it hid away safe, along with my sense of trust, Mr. Clent. I don't use 'em much in case they get scratched." -- Frances Hardinge

item.title: Chris add a quote by Frances Hardinge
item.description: "If you want someone to tell you what to think," the phantom answered briskly, without looking up, "you will never be short of people willing to do so." . . . "Come now," he said at last, "you can hardly claim that I have left you ignorant. I taught you to read, did I not?" -- Frances Hardinge

item.title: Chris add a quote by Alan Madison
item.description:
"Dearest dumpling, one day your imagination is going to get you into trouble," whispered his mother.
He would never do that," Pecorino replied. "We're best friends." -- Alan Madison

item.title: Chris add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Even if it's not your fault, it's your responsibility." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Chris add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Knowing things is magical, if other people don't know them." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Chris add a quote by Frank Portman
item.description: "Normal: lacking in taste, compassion, understanding, kindness, and ordinary human decency." -- Frank Portman

item.title: Chris add a quote by Frank Portman
item.description: "D and D: a role-playing game played only by very cool guys." -- Frank Portman

item.title: Chris add a quote by Frank Portman
item.description: "Girls have all the same parts, basically, and so much of how they look depends on the attitude, expectations, and obsessions of those who are looking at them." -- Frank Portman

item.title: Chris add a quote by David Ives
item.description: "He might have thought white people was coyotes, but he still shared food with me. Long as people do that, I guess it don't matter what they think of you." -- David Ives

item.title: Chris add a quote by David Ives
item.description: "I felt flattered to be the kinda person one would kick out of a saloon. That takes some character." -- David Ives

item.title: Chris add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I know, up on top you are seeing great sights, but down here at the bottom we, too, should have rights." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Chris add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Books are like mirrors: if a fool looks in, you cannot expect a genius to look out." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Chris add a quote by Matthew Polly
item.description: "It is difficult for my fellow countrymen who have never lived abroad to understand that until a foreign man is about sixty-five, he still thinks, every so often, that under the right circumstances he'd like to punch an American in the face. Even people like the Chinese, who mostly like us, think of us--at least partly--as loud, fat, poorly dressed, overprivileged, hectoring, naive, arrogant, self-righteous bullies with little knowledge and no interest in any culture other than our own. I once had a conversation with a Japanese journalist who said to me, "You don't seem like an American." When I asked him, slightly hurt, why he said that, he replied, "Because you listen." -- Matthew Polly

item.title: Chris add a quote by James Turner
item.description: "Just because I'm a librarian doesn't mean I'm at all tame." -- James Turner

item.title: Chris add a quote by Joanne Harris
Chris add a quote by Susan Palwick
item.description: "I realized then how much alike we were. Both of us looked backwards to a beloved time that was lost to us, a time where everything had been beautiful. Both of us looked forward to some time and place that would be better. And both of us were here, now, in a grim, unhappy time where little was as we wanted it to be. We lived in our memories and in our hopes, enduring the present because we had no other choice, and because we loved the people who lived here with us." -- Susan Palwick
